attributes.action: inform Sudan that we will terminate all British aid and call for international economic sanctions against it unless the teacher being illegally held for naming a teddy bear Mohammed is released immediately
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The British government's first duty is to protect its citizens and Gillian Gibbons has done nothing more than give herself over to teaching poor African children. She requires full government assistance.

The government must impose maximum pressure on Sudan including suspending all British aid, suspending all flights to the country and seeking international sanctions until Gillian Gibbons is released unharmed.

rejection.details: This petition is no longer relevant.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
